fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Competition, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market
eu_initiatives: ICE follows EU policy developments across a number of policy areas, including financial services, energy policy and climate change.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
-    Federation of European Securities Exchanges (FESE) 
-    European Association of CCP Clearing Houses (EACH) 
-    Association of European Energy Exchanges (Europex) 
-    Commodity Markets Council (CMC) 
-    Eurofi 
-       International Emissions Trading Association (IETA)
goals__remit: Intercontinental Exchange is a Fortune 500 and Fortune Future 50 company formed in the year 2000 to modernize markets. ICE serves customers by operating the exchanges, clearing houses and information services they rely upon to invest, trade and manage risk across global financial and commodity markets. A leader in market data, ICE Data Services serves the information and connectivity needs across virtually all asset classes. As the parent company of the New York Stock Exchange, the company raises more capital than any other exchange in the world, driving economic growth and transforming markets.
